title: Sampler, 1798
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation
inscribed: Ann Thornton Aged nine Years Anno Domini 1798
provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description:
Several bands of alphabets and numerals separated by geometric and floral cross borders, with a verse and inscription: 
God give me grace i ask no more
Contentment is a constant store 
Ann Thornton Aged nine Years Anno Domini 1798

In the lower half, a landscape showing trees growing out of mounds with animals, birds, insects, and baskets of flowers. With an angular strawberry vine border.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1798.
1798. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-52.
